message.project_inception.empty_hand_war: Click with an empty hand to activate.
message.project_inception.taterwebz_cras: Warning: the Project Inception browser child process has crashed. Taterwebz browsers will stop working; please restart the game to fix this. If the problem persists, please open an issue at https://github.com/Arc-blroth/ProjectInception/issues
gui.project_inception.incompatible_jre.d: Due to an obscure bug in Java

,
Project Inception may not work on the default Ubuntu OpenJDK packages. If embedded browsers fail to launch, please try using a JRE/JDK build from AdoptOpenJDK. (You can disable this warning in the config)
gui.project_inception.openj9_warning.des: To get Project Inception to work on OpenJ9, please add "-XX:+CompactStrings" (without the quotes) to the Java VM arguments in the launcher, then restart the game.
message.project_inception.splash3: What if its all just a simulation?
message.project_inception.splash8: Warning: continued usage of Project Inception may cause loss of sanity
config.projectInception.title: Project Inception Config
config.projectInception.inception.dpi.to: The pixels per block that inception displays render at.
Note that setting this value too high may result in
a lower DPI than specified or rendering issues.
config.projectInception.inception.extra_: Appended to the command line of inception instances.
config.projectInception.inception.use_te: Note that these recipes are significantly more late-game than vanilla.
On servers, you must configure this by editing the config file.
config.projectInception.inception.use_fa: For developers: this makes the child process
not actually init Minecraft so that I can test
config.projectInception.taterwebz.dpi.to: The pixels per block that taterwebz browsers render at.
Note that setting this value too high may result in
config.projectInception.taterwebz.home_p: The home page for new taterwebz browsers.
config.projectInception.taterwebz.warn_i: Shows a screen while loading if a possibly incompatible
Java 9+ OpenJDK build for Ubuntu is used.
